prompt: <description>**Part 1: Cylindrical Object with a Tapered Top and Bottom** Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [-90.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0561, 0.0] Now, create a sketch on the X-Y plane of the new coordinate system. The sketch has one face containing a single loop. The loop has the following components: 1. Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.5724], End Point [0.0723, 0.5724] 2. Arc 1: Start Point [0.0723, 0.5724], Mid Point [0.3189, 0.0592], End Point [0.5654, 0.5724] 3. Line 2: Start Point [0.5654, 0.5724], End Point [0.6377, 0.5724] 4. Arc 2: Start Point [0.6377, 0.5724], Mid Point [0.3189, 0.0], End Point [0.0, 0.5724] The loop is closed and consists of four curves. The face enclosed by the loop describes the initial 2D shape. Next, set the sketch scale to 0.6377. Transform the 2D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector defined earlier. Then, extrude the sketch along the normal direction with a depth of 0.5526 while maintaining the same scale. The opposite normal extrusion depth is 0.0. Select the "NewBodyFeatureOperation" operation for the extrusion. This completes the construction of the first part, which is a cylindrical object with a slightly tapered top and bottom. The length, width, and height of this part are 0.5526, 0.6377, and 0.6377, respectively. The overall final shape description is: > A cylindrical object with a slightly tapered top and bottom. The cylinder has a slightly tapered shape, with the top being wider than the bottom. The object is symmetrical along its central axis.</description>

prompt: <description>**Instructions for Creating the Final Shape** The final shape is a rectangular prism with a slightly tapered top. To create this shape, we will first construct the base part, followed by the top part. **<part\\_1>: Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom.** Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles 0.0, 0.0, -90.0 and a translation vector of 0.0, 0.1, 0.0. Create a 2D sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system. Within this sketch, create a rectangle by drawing four lines as follows: - Line 1: Starting at (0.0, 0.0), ending at (0.75, 0.0) - Line 2: Starting at (0.75, 0.0), ending at (0.75, 0.175) - Line 3: Starting at (0.75, 0.175), ending at (0.0, 0.175) - Line 4: Starting at (0.0, 0.175), ending at (0.0, 0.0) Scale the 2D sketch by a factor the square root of 0.75. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector defined in the coordinate system. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model, with an extrusion depth towards the normal of 0.1 and no depth in the opposite direction. **<part\\_2>: Construct the slightly tapered top.** Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles 90.0, 0.0, -90.0 and a translation vector of 0.0, 0.0625, 0.075. Create a 2D sketch on the XZ plane of the coordinate system. Within this sketch, create a circle by adding a center point at (0.0125, 0.0125) and a radius of 0.0125. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.025. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector defined in the coordinate system. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model, with no depth towards the normal and an extrusion depth opposite the normal of 0.1875. Perform a cut operation with this part to remove the material from part\\_1. The resulting shape will be a rectangular prism with a slightly tapered top, as described in the "final\\_shape" property of the JSON.</description>
